page.title: 10A Gamekeeper's Life
page.content: My dad gets up at 6.30am. He gets his gun out and cleans it. Then the soldiers come with a guest. Dad takes the guest up on to the hill and they go stalking. They walk for miles over the hill. Dad and the guest cannot shoot just any deer. It has to be old or ill and the right type and in the right season. My dad starts the day by hoping that he will get more than nothing. In October dad gets Roe deer. In November dad looks for Red deer. My dad walks the same route every day. If my dad sees one to shoot but hasn't got a chance he waits at that spot next day because he knows it will return.
